connectivity.title: One device. Every energy asset.

zeroOEM.title: Zero OEM Dependence

sovereignData.title: Sovereign Data

hero.title: The Local API
hero.description: Grid frequency must balance every second. Cloud APIs respond in 2-5 seconds. We built the infrastructure layer that bridges this gap: local execution at 200ms, compatible with 180M EU smart meters today.

preview.title: See the platform in action

architecture.title: Three-layer architecture
architecture.description: Local execution where speed matters. Cloud intelligence where it adds value.

edge.title: Edge Layer
edge.subtitle: The Zap Gateway
edge.description: Local execution in 200ms. Offline-capable, protocol-agnostic, data sovereign. Runs automations without cloud dependency.

coordination.title: Coordination Layer
coordination.subtitle: Sourceful Platform
coordination.description: Aggregates devices, optimizes energy flows, and interfaces with grid operators. The brain of the operation.

cloud.title: Cloud Layer
cloud.subtitle: Analytics & Intelligence
cloud.description: Long-term analytics, machine learning, and reporting. The cloud does what cloud does best.

localExecution.title: Why local execution matters
localExecution.description1: Grid frequency must balance every second. Cloud APIs respond in 2-5 seconds. This gap is unbridgeable through software optimization alone.
localExecution.description2: Our platform pushes execution to the edge. The Zap gateway responds in 200ms, works offline, and keeps data local. The cloud handles what cloud does best: analytics, optimization, and coordination at scale.
localExecution.metersNote: Compatible with 180M EU smart meters today. More integrations coming.

hero.title: The Zap Gateway
hero.description: Local execution at the edge. 200ms response time, offline-capable, protocol-agnostic. The missing piece that makes distributed energy actually work.

features.title: Why the Zap?
features.description: Cloud latency kills real-time control. The Zap responds in 200ms because it executes locally. No round-trip to the cloud.

speed.title: Lightning Fast
speed.description: Local execution means real-time control. No cloud latency, no network dependencies.

offline.title: Offline Capable
offline.description: Keeps working when internet goes down. Essential for critical energy infrastructure.

protocols.title: Protocol Agnostic
protocols.description: P1, Modbus RTU/TCP, MQTT, OCPP 1.6/2.0. Works with your existing equipment.

sovereignty.title: Data Sovereignty
sovereignty.description: Your energy data stays local. Choose what to share with the cloud.

pricing.title: Sold at cost
pricing.description: We're a platform company, not a hardware company. The Zap is sold at BOM cost to maximize adoption. We make money on platform services.

hero.title: Unlock distributed
hero.description: Enable grid services at scale with local execution. 200ms response time for frequency regulation, demand response, and more.

problem.title: The coordination gap is costing you billions
problem.paragraph1: 40-70 million EVs in Europe by 2030. 2,800 GWh of distributed storage that needs coordination. Cloud APIs respond in 2-5 seconds - but grid frequency must balance every second.
problem.paragraph2: The result? €2.5B destroyed annually in coordination failures. 700+ hours of negative electricity pricing. Assets sitting idle when the grid needs them most.
problem.paragraph3: We bridge this gap with local execution infrastructure.

benefits.title: Why utilities partner with us
benefits.description: We enable utilities to deliver real grid services - not just dashboards.

coordinationFailures.title: Reduce Coordination Failures

distributedFlexibility.title: Unlock Distributed Flexibility

painPoints.title: The real problem with mixed-brand systems
painPoints.description: Every installation is unique. Every combination creates new headaches.

softwareSpaghetti.title: Software spaghetti
softwareSpaghetti.description: Huawei app for the inverter. Tesla app for the Powerwall. Zaptec app for the charger. Your customers juggle 3-4 apps that don't talk to each other.

supportCallbacks.title: Support callbacks
supportCallbacks.description: "It stopped working after an update." "The apps aren't syncing." "My EV isn't charging at the right times." You become unpaid software support.

ecosystemConflicts.title: Ecosystem conflicts

items.question: Who handles the customer subscription?
items.answer: We do. The customer pays €5/month directly to Sourceful. You focus on installation work, not subscription administration.

items.question: What if a customer has a problem?
items.answer: They contact us, not you. We provide Swedish and English technical support for all platform-related issues. Hardware issues still go through normal warranty channels.

items.question: What if a brand isn't supported?
items.answer: Tell us. We add new integrations based on installer demand. Most common brands are already supported, and we're adding more every month.

items.question: Do I need training?
items.answer: The Zap installs in 5 minutes. Most installers figure it out immediately. We provide optional training materials and partner portal access for larger teams.

problem.title: Your hardware is smart. Make it grid-smart.

v2x.waitlistSuccess: You're on the V2X waitlist! We'll notify you when it's your turn.

whatIsV2X.question: What is V2X?
whatIsV2X.answer: V2X (Vehicle-to-Everything) allows your electric vehicle to not just charge, but also discharge power back to your home (V2H) or the grid (V2G). Your EV becomes a mobile battery that can power your home, earn money from grid services, or provide backup during outages.

requirements.question: What do I need for V2X?
requirements.answer: You need three things: a Zap gateway (€69), a bidirectional EV charger (Ambibox is supported now, with Ferroamp, Charge Amps, Easee, and Zaptec coming soon), and a Zap Pro subscription (€60/year). Your EV must also support V2X - check our compatibility list for supported models.

savings.question: How much can I save with V2X?
savings.answer: Typical V2X users save €500-1,500 per year through a combination of energy arbitrage (charging when cheap, discharging when expensive), peak shaving, and grid services participation. Actual savings depend on your electricity prices and usage patterns.

batteryHealth.question: Does V2X damage my EV battery?
batteryHealth.answer: Modern EV batteries are designed for thousands of charge cycles. Our smart algorithms optimize charging patterns to minimize battery wear. Studies show V2X usage typically adds less than 1% additional degradation per year when managed properly.

scheduling.question: Can I still schedule my car's charging normally?
scheduling.answer: Absolutely. You set your departure time and minimum charge level, and Sourceful handles the rest. Your car will always be ready when you need it - we just optimize when and how it charges (and discharges) to save you money.

batteryDrained.question: Will my car's battery ever be completely drained?
batteryDrained.answer: Never. You set a minimum charge level (e.g., 20%) that we'll never go below. The system also learns your driving patterns and ensures you always have enough charge for your typical daily needs, plus a safety buffer.

compatibleEVs.question: Which EVs are compatible with V2X?
compatibleEVs.answer: V2X requires an EV with bidirectional charging capability. Currently supported models include most CHAdeMO vehicles (Nissan Leaf, Mitsubishi Outlander PHEV) and newer CCS vehicles with V2X support. Check our compatibility page for the full list of supported vehicles.

technicalExpertise.question: Do I need technical expertise to use V2X?
technicalExpertise.answer: Not at all. Once your bidirectional charger is installed by a certified electrician, you simply connect your Zap, download our app, and follow the setup wizard. The system handles all the complex optimization automatically.

hero.title: Building the local energy
hero.description: We're a team of engineers obsessed with a simple problem: how do you coordinate millions of distributed energy devices at the speed physics demands?

mission.title: Our mission
mission.paragraph1: The energy system is flipping from centralized to distributed. 40-70 million EVs in Europe by 2030. Rooftop solar on every house. Batteries in every garage. This is happening.
mission.paragraph2: But distributed energy only works if it's coordinated. And coordination requires speed. Grid frequency must balance every second. Cloud APIs respond in 2-5 seconds. The gap is unbridgeable through software alone.
mission.paragraph3: We're building the local execution layer that makes distributed energy coordination actually possible.

physicsBeforeCode.title: Physics Before Code
physicsBeforeCode.description: Every technical decision starts with: 'What does the physical system require?'

simpleOverClever.title: Simple Over Clever
simpleOverClever.description: If you're proud of how clever it is, simplify it.

localOverCloud.title: Local Over Cloud
localOverCloud.description: Default to local. Cloud is opt-in, not assumed.

robustOverFeatureRich.title: Robust Over Feature-Rich
robustOverFeatureRich.description: Ship something that works 100% before adding features.

principles.title: Engineering principles
principles.description: How we build software that works at the speed of physics.

location.title: Nordic roots, global ambition
location.paragraph1: We're based in Kalmar, Sweden - on the southeastern coast, close to our first utility partners. From here, we're building the infrastructure for the global energy transition.
location.paragraph2: Our first markets are the Nordics and Northern Europe, where grid infrastructure is ready for distributed energy. But our technology works anywhere there's a grid.

team.title: Meet the team
team.description: Engineers, builders, and energy enthusiasts working to coordinate the world's distributed energy.

backedBy.title: Backed by
backedBy.description: Supported by investors who understand energy infrastructure.

cta.title: Want to join us?
cta.description: We're building something that matters. If you're excited about distributed energy and local-first software, let's talk.

hero.title: Build the future of
hero.description: We're a small team solving big problems. No open roles right now, but we're always looking for exceptional people.

noJobs.title: No open positions
noJobs.subtitle: But that doesn't mean we're not hiring
noJobs.description: We don't have specific roles listed, but the best people we've hired weren't responding to job posts. If you're passionate about distributed energy, local-first software, or building infrastructure that matters, we want to hear from you.

builder.title: Builders
builder.description: People who ship. Whether it's code, design, or strategy, you make things happen.

curious.title: Curious minds
curious.description: You dig deeper. You ask why. You're not satisfied with surface-level answers.

ownership.title: Ownership mentality
ownership.description: You don't wait to be told what to do. You see problems and solve them.

apply.title: Introduce yourself
apply.description: Tell us who you are and why Sourceful interests you. No CV required, just be genuine.

location.title: Based in Kalmar, Sweden
location.description: We're a remote-first company, but our roots are in Kalmar. We believe in async work, deep focus, and occasionally getting together in person.

hero.title: Insights &
hero.description: News, insights, and deep dives into the energy transition, grid services, V2X technology, and smart energy management from the Sourceful team.

blog.emptyState: No articles found in this category.

cta.title: Stay up to date
cta.description: Get the latest insights on energy management, grid services, and the energy transition delivered to your inbox.

cta.title: Ready to optimize your energy?
cta.description: Join thousands of homeowners and businesses using Sourceful to reduce costs and participate in the energy transition.

hero.title: The last-mile problem
hero.description: Renewable energy costs have dropped 90%. Solar is on every roof. EVs are in every garage. The generation problem is solved.
hero.paragraph2: But energy coordination is still broken. The grid can't talk to your battery. Your EV doesn't know when electricity is cheapest. Your solar panels don't coordinate with your neighbors.
hero.paragraph3: The coordination layer is missing. We're building it.

coordinator.title: Universal coordinator
coordinator.description: The Zap gateway supports P1, Modbus, MQTT, OCPP - every protocol that matters.

subscription.title: Platform subscription
subscription.description: Captures €1,000-2,500 in annual value through optimization and grid services.

architecture.title: Platform architecture
architecture.description: Homes become programmable APIs. Developers build on top. Network effects compound.

network.title: Network effects
network.description: Value increases with every connection. Winner-take-most dynamics.

whyWin.title: Why Sourceful will win
whyWin.description: This is an infrastructure transition. Like AWS vs. hardware manufacturers. Like internet protocols vs. telecom. Like payment platforms vs. banks.

utilities.title: Utilities can't build this
utilities.description: They're optimizing for centralized control, not distributed coordination.

manufacturers.title: Manufacturers won't
manufacturers.description: They prefer closed ecosystems that lock in customers.

traditional.title: Traditional energy firms
traditional.description: They're solving yesterday's problems with yesterday's architecture.

winnerTakemost.title: Winner-take-most dynamics
winnerTakemost.description: In network-effect markets, second place is worth 10x less than first. We're building to be first - in the Nordics, then Europe, then everywhere there's a grid.

funding.title: €3M Seed raised
funding.paragraph1: January 2025. Led by Crucible Capital and Eviny Ventures, with participation from Variant Fund, Paper Ventures, and Kosmos Capital.
funding.paragraph2: We're building network effects in a €500B market. The capital is deployed into infrastructure that compounds - every device connected makes the next connection more valuable.

roadmap.title: Growth roadmap
roadmap.description: Network effects unlock at each milestone. Value compounds exponentially.

1000.description: Critical mass for local grid services

seriesA.title: Infrastructure coordination at scale
seriesA.paragraph1: Platform companies trade at 40x revenue (Stripe). Utilities trade at 1.5x. We're building a platform company in a utility market.
seriesA.paragraph2: If you're deploying capital into energy infrastructure with network effects, let's talk.

companyInfo.disclaimer: Content provided for general information purposes. Not financial advice or investment solicitation.

hero.title: Build the future of energy

support.title: Support
support.description: Need help? Our support team is available through Intercom for technical questions and troubleshooting.

tenPercent.label: The 10%
tenPercent.title: Community-driven development
tenPercent.paragraph1: We're 90% B2B - working with utilities, OEMs, and installers. But 10% of our focus is on the community: early adopters, developers, and energy enthusiasts who help us build something better.
tenPercent.paragraph2: The community provides feedback, tests new features, and keeps us honest. In return, they get early access, direct influence on the roadmap, and a voice in how we build.

earlyAccess.title: Early access
earlyAccess.description: Test new features before public release

openSource.title: Open source
openSource.description: MIT licensed, build what you want

cta.description: Whether you're a developer, installer, or just curious about distributed energy, there's a place for you in our community.

hero.title: Build energy apps that

features.description: Built for developers who need real-time control over energy infrastructure.

localResponse.title: 200ms Local Response
localResponse.description: Execute commands at the edge. No round-trip to the cloud for time-critical operations.

protocolAgnostic.title: Protocol Agnostic
protocolAgnostic.description: P1, Modbus, MQTT, OCPP - we handle the translation layer so you don't have to.

results.insightNegativeNoLoss: Negative prices occurred, but you weren't affected
results.insightNegativeNoLossDesc: {zone} had {hours} hours of negative prices (as low as {price} {currency}/kWh), but they occurred at night when your solar panels weren't producing. In summer, negative prices often occur during sunny midday hours when you would be exporting power.
results.insightNoNegative: Good news! No negative prices during this period
results.insightNoNegativeDesc: The {zone} zone had no negative electricity prices between {from} and {to}. However, negative prices are becoming more common as renewable energy grows. Stay prepared with smart energy control.
results.insightDescription: In {zone}, there were {hours} hours of negative prices. Without smart control, you paid approximately {amount} {currency} to export power during these times.
results.readyDescription: The Zap gateway automatically curtails or stores production during negative prices, so you never pay to give away power.
results.readyPreparedDescription: The Zap gateway automatically manages your energy during negative price events, so you're always protected.
results.disclaimer: * Analysis based on historical spot prices and estimated production profiles. Actual results depend on your specific system configuration and real production patterns.

v2xSavings.usableNote: Limiting V2X usage preserves battery health while still providing significant value.
v2xSavings.infoNote: V2X (Vehicle-to-Everything) allows your EV to power your home during expensive peak hours and charge during cheap off-peak times. This creates savings through energy arbitrage.

features.title: Everything you need to manage your energy

hero.title: Get Started with
hero.description: Select the type of device you want to connect. The Zap gateway works with both electricity meters and solar inverters.

meter.title: Electricity Meter with P1 Port
meter.subtitle: RJ12 Connection
meter.description: Connect your Zap directly to your electricity meter's P1 data port for real-time consumption monitoring.

inverter.title: Inverter with Modbus TCP/IP
inverter.subtitle: Wi-Fi Connection
inverter.description: Connect your solar inverter via Modbus TCP/IP for production monitoring and smart optimization.

compatibility.title: Device Compatibility
compatibility.description: Zap currently supports all meters with a P1 port (RJ12) and Solis, Sungrow, and Deye inverters with Modbus TCP/IP. Check our compatibility guide for the full list of supported devices.

noZap.title: Don't have a Zap yet?
noZap.description: The Zap gateway is the hardware that connects your energy devices to Sourceful. It's small, affordable, and easy to install.

zap.title: Connect Zap to Your
zap.description: Follow this 6-step guide to connect your Zap gateway to an electricity meter with a P1 (RJ12) port. Setup typically takes 10-15 minutes.

step1.title: Enable P1 Port on Your Meter
step1.description: Contact your grid operator (e.g., Ellevio, Vattenfall, E.ON) to enable the P1 (RJ12) data port. This can often be done via their website or by calling their support team for remote activation.

tips.tip1: Most grid operators can enable P1 remotely within 24-48 hours
tips.tip2: The service is usually free of charge
tips.tip3: You may need your meter ID (found on the meter itself)

warning.title: Safety Warning
warning.message: Do not tamper with your electricity meter. Only connect devices to the designated P1 port. Read the Safety Information before setup.

step2.title: Connect Zap to Energy Meter
step2.description: Once your grid operator confirms P1 data is enabled, connect the Zap device to your electricity meter using the included RJ12 cable. The P1 port is typically located on the front or bottom of your meter.

tips.tip1: The Zap powers itself from the P1 port - no separate power needed
tips.tip2: Make sure the cable clicks securely into place
tips.tip3: Position the Zap within range of your Wi-Fi router

step3.title: Check LED Indicators
step3.description: After connection, verify these lights activate on your Zap device:

tips.tip1: If no lights appear, check the cable connection
tips.tip2: The blue LED indicates the device is ready for setup

step4.title: Verify Data Transfer
step4.description: The green data LED should start blinking when receiving meter data. This indicates your meter is sending consumption data to the Zap.

tips.tip1: This step might take a few minutes
tips.tip2: The LED blinks each time data is received (typically every 10 seconds)
tips.tip3: If it doesn't blink, your P1 port may not be enabled yet

step5.title: Download and Configure App
step5.description: Download the Sourceful Energy app from the App Store or Google Play. Create your account and register your Zap following the on-screen instructions.

tips.tip1: Make sure Bluetooth is enabled on your phone
tips.tip2: Keep your phone close to the Zap during setup
tips.tip3: You'll need to connect the Zap to your Wi-Fi network

step6.title: Completion Verification
step6.description: When fully operational, your Zap and app should show the following:

tips.tip1: The app should display real-time energy consumption
tips.tip3: The Zap now communicates via Wi-Fi

help.title: Need Help?
help.description: If you encounter any issues during setup, check our Help Centre for troubleshooting guides or join our community for support.

next.title: What's Next?
next.description: Once connected, explore the Sourceful app to monitor your energy usage, set up alerts, and start optimizing your consumption.

inverter.title: Connect Zap to Your
inverter.description: Follow this 6-step guide to connect your Zap gateway to a solar inverter via Modbus TCP/IP. Setup typically takes 15-20 minutes.

step1.title: Locate Inverter Network Settings
step1.description: Gather your inverter's network settings: IP address, Unit ID, and Port Number. These can typically be found on the inverter's display or through your installer.

tips.tip2: Unit ID: Often 1 or 247 (check your inverter's documentation)

info.title: Modbus TCP Required
info.message: If Modbus TCP is not enabled on your inverter, ask your installer to enable it or check our configuration guides. Some inverters require direct RS485 wired connections instead.

step2.title: Power the Zap Device
step2.description: The Zap needs power to operate. You have two options:

optionA.title: Option A: P1 Meter Port
optionA.description: Connect to your electricity meter's P1 (RJ12) port for power and meter data

optionB.title: Option B: USB-C Power
optionB.description: Use any USB-C power source: phone charger, computer, or inverter's USB port

tips.tip1: The Zap must remain within range of your Wi-Fi router
tips.tip2: If using USB-C, ensure the power source is always on
tips.tip3: P1 connection provides both power AND meter data

step3.title: Check LED Indicators
step3.description: After powering on, verify these lights activate on your Zap device:

tips.tip1: If no lights appear, check the power connection
tips.tip2: The blue LED indicates the device is ready for setup
tips.tip3: Troubleshooting guide available in our Help Centre

step4.title: Download the Sourceful App
step4.description: Install the Sourceful Energy app from the App Store or Google Play Store. Create an account and register your Zap device following on-screen prompts.

tips.tip1: Bluetooth must be enabled on your phone
tips.tip2: Keep your phone close to the Zap during setup
tips.tip3: You'll connect the Zap to your Wi-Fi network through the app

step5.title: Connect Your Inverter
step5.description: In the app, select 'Add an Energy Device' and enter the network settings from Step 1. The app will connect to your inverter via Modbus TCP.

tips.tip1: Make sure the Zap and inverter are on the same network
tips.tip2: Enter the IP address, port, and unit ID exactly as found in Step 1
tips.tip3: The system supports up to three DERs (at least one must be an energy meter)

info.title: Multiple Devices
info.message: You can connect multiple energy devices (solar, battery, meter) to a single Zap. Add them one at a time through the app.

step6.title: Verify Successful Connection
step6.description: When fully operational, your Zap and app should show the following:

tips.tip1: The app should display real-time solar production data
tips.tip3: The Zap now communicates via Wi-Fi

help.title: Need Help?
help.description: If you encounter any issues during setup, check our Help Centre for inverter-specific configuration guides or join our community for support.

next.title: What's Next?
next.description: Once connected, explore the Sourceful app to monitor your solar production, optimize self-consumption, and manage grid exports.

dataController.title: Data Controller
dataController.paragraph1: Sourceful Labs AB (Corporate ID: 559382-0458) is responsible for processing your personal data. We are committed to protecting your privacy and handling your data in accordance with GDPR and applicable Swedish law.

analytics.title: Website Analytics
analytics.paragraph1: We collect anonymized usage data through analytics cookies and Google Analytics, including an encrypted version of your IP address and device information. This data is retained for 26 months.
analytics.optOut: You may opt out of Google Analytics by using Google's browser add-on available at

waitlist.title: Service Interest & Waitlist
waitlist.paragraph1: We process names, emails, and contact details from interest forms based on legitimate interest in reaching out to customers. This data is stored for one year after request handling.

contract.title: Contract & Hardware Provision
contract.paragraph1: Personal data including name, address, and payment information are processed to fulfill subscription agreements and device orders under contract performance requirements.

device.title: Device Connectivity (Zap Device)
device.paragraph1: Sourceful scans local networks to locate distributed energy resources. We retain inverter IP addresses and network configuration details for seamless functionality of the Zap device.

energyData.title: Energy Data Collection
energyData.paragraph1: Real-time electricity consumption data, timestamps, and meter readings are collected through the Zap device. This data is retained for 36 months after service termination for support purposes.

activeControl.title: Active Control Feature
activeControl.paragraph1: When you enable automated controls for batteries, chargers, and inverters, we process real-time energy data to optimize device performance.

marketing.title: Marketing & Analytics Tools
marketing.paragraph1: We use the following tools for advertising measurement and user behavior analysis:

rights.title: Your Rights
rights.paragraph1: Under GDPR, you have the right to:
list: Access your personal data
Rectify inaccurate data
Erase your data ("right to be forgotten")
Restrict processing
Data portability
Object to processing
Lodge a complaint with the Swedish Authority for Privacy Protection (IMY)

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.paragraph1: For privacy-related inquiries, please contact us at

introduction.title: 1. Introduction
introduction.paragraph1: These Terms and Conditions govern your use of services provided by Sourceful Labs AB (Swedish registration number: 559382-0458), including the Sourceful Platform, Zap hardware device, mobile application, and cloud services.
introduction.paragraph2: By using our services, you agree to these terms. Please read them carefully.

services.title: 2. Services Overview
services.paragraph1: Sourceful provides an energy management platform including the Zap hardware device, mobile app, and cloud services for monitoring and controlling distributed energy resources such as solar panels, batteries, EV chargers, and heat pumps.

zapPurchase.title: 3A. Zap Device Purchase
list: The Zap device is a one-time purchase with ownership transfer upon delivery
You have a 30-day right of withdrawal from the date of delivery
Device must be returned in resalable condition for full refund
Self-installation with provided instructions
One-year commercial warranty covering manufacturing defects

subscription.title: 3B. Subscription Services
list: Optional paid plans available for additional features beyond the free tier
Billed monthly or annually in advance
Cancellation available anytime; takes effect at billing period end
Sourceful may terminate with 30 days notice or immediately for material breach
Free tier remains accessible after subscription ends

responsibilities.title: 4. User Responsibilities
list: Providing accurate account information
Maintaining the security of your account credentials
Ensuring proper installation and use of hardware
Complying with local electrical codes and regulations
Using services only for lawful purposes

prohibited.title: 5. Prohibited Activities
list: Reverse-engineer, copy, or modify the software or hardware
Manipulate energy data or readings
Automate interactions beyond intended use
Commit fraud or misrepresent information
Use services to harm the grid or other users
prohibited.paragraph2: Violations may result in access suspension or termination.

consumer.title: 6. Consumer Protections
consumer.paragraph1: Under Swedish consumer law, defective devices qualify for remedies in the following priority:
list: Repair or replacement
Price reduction
Cancellation with full refund
consumer.paragraph2: Claims are valid for three years after delivery.

liability.title: 7. Limitation of Liability
liability.paragraph1: To the maximum extent permitted by law, Sourceful's liability is limited to the amount you paid for the services. We are not liable for indirect, incidental, or consequential damages, including lost profits or data loss.

dataPrivacy.title: 8. Data & Privacy
dataPrivacy.paragraph2: . Authentication is handled via Privy. Data may be shared with partners under GDPR compliance requirements.

ip.title: 9. Intellectual Property
ip.paragraph1: All software, hardware designs, trademarks, and content are owned by Sourceful Labs AB. Your purchase grants a license to use, not ownership of intellectual property.

changes.title: 10. Changes to Terms
changes.paragraph1: We may update these terms with reasonable notice. Continued use after changes constitutes acceptance. Material changes will be communicated via email or in-app notification.

governing.title: 11. Governing Law
governing.paragraph1: These terms are governed by Swedish substantive law. Disputes will be resolved through negotiation or Swedish courts. Consumers may also contact the Swedish Consumer Agency (Konsumentverket) or the National Board for Consumer Disputes (ARN).

contact.title: 12. Contact
contact.paragraph1: For questions about these terms, contact us at

rewards.disclaimer: Rewards are subject to program terms. Points do not represent currency or guaranteed value. Future reward options may include vouchers, discounts, or other benefits.

connectDevices.title: Connect your devices
connectDevices.description: Link your solar, battery, or EV charger to start earning

optimizeUsage.title: Optimize automatically
optimizeUsage.description: Smart scheduling earns you more points over time

earnPoints.title: Unlock rewards
earnPoints.description: Redeem points for future benefits and exclusive perks

customerLoyalty.title: Built-in loyalty program
customerLoyalty.description: Offer your customers rewards without building infrastructure

brandedRewards.title: White-label rewards
brandedRewards.description: Your brand, your rewards program, powered by Sourceful

increaseEngagement.title: Boost engagement
increaseEngagement.description: Keep customers active and reduce churn with ongoing incentives

earnPerInstall.title: Earn per installation
earnPerInstall.description: Get rewarded every time you connect a customer

recurringRewards.title: Ongoing commissions
recurringRewards.description: Continue earning as your customers use the platform

customerReferrals.title: Referral bonuses
customerReferrals.description: Grow your network and earn extra for referrals

homeowners.title: Earn rewards while you save
homeowners.description: Connect your energy devices and start earning points. Redeem for future benefits as our rewards program grows.

utilities.title: Built-in customer loyalty
utilities.description: Offer your customers a rewards program without the overhead. Increase engagement, reduce churn, and differentiate your offering with Sourceful-powered incentives.

installers.title: Get rewarded for every install
installers.description: Earn points for each device you connect. Build a recurring income stream as your customers benefit from smart energy optimization.

pricing.title: Simple Pricing
pricing.subtitle: Hardware you own. Software when you need it.

zap.name: Zap Core
zap.description: Includes Zap device and free iOS/Android app

ems.name: Zap Pro
ems.priceNote:
Includes free Zap.
Only €2.50/mo if you already own one.

zapCore.question: What's included with Zap Core?
zapCore.answer: Every Zap (€69) gives you real-time energy data, unlimited API access for your devices, and both local and cloud control. Build whatever you want with it.

zapPro.question: What does Zap Pro add?
zapPro.answer: Zap Pro (€60/year) unlocks advanced features including V2X (vehicle-to-grid) capability, load balancing, optimization algorithms, and device health alerts. New subscribers get a free Zap included. Already have a Zap? Upgrade to Pro for just €2.50/month.

multipleZaps.question: Can I use multiple Zaps?
multipleZaps.answer: Yes! Each Zap you own gives you API access for that device. No extra fees, no per-device limits. Buy more Zaps, control more devices.

support.question: What kind of support do I get?
support.answer: All users get community support via Discord. Enterprise customers get dedicated support with SLA guarantees.

refunds.question: What about refunds and delivery?
refunds.answer: Free delivery in the EU. 30-day money back guarantee on hardware. Cancel your Zap Pro subscription anytime, no questions asked.

whatsInBox.question: What's in the box?
whatsInBox.answer: You get the Zap device and power cable. The Sourceful app (iOS & Android) is free to download. EV chargers and other hardware are sold separately through our partners.
